paragraphs.text: The Nommo Award is a literary award presented by The African Speculative Fiction Society. The award is named after the Nommo. The awards recognize works of speculative fiction by Africans, defined as "science fiction, fantasy, stories of magic and traditional belief, alternative histories, horror and strange stuff that might not fit in anywhere else."[1] The Nommo Awards have four categories for best Novel, Novella, Short Story, and Graphic Novel.

paragraphs.title: Winners and short list nominees
paragraphs.text: The Novel Award is also known as The Ilube Nommo Award for Best Speculative Fiction Novel by an African.

paragraphs.title: The African Speculative Fiction Society
paragraphs.text:
The African Speculative Fiction Society (ASFS) promotes science fiction and fantasy by Africans. Its 58 charter members include writers, editors, artists and publishers.


Members nominate and vote on the Nommo Awards for African Speculative Fiction.[11]
[citation needed]

Established August 15, 2016 with 58 charter members, the ASFS and its Nommo Awards is a body for African science fiction/fantasy professionals.[12][13]

paragraphs.title: Logo design
paragraphs.text: The Nommo Awards logo and ASFS logos were designed in 2016 by Stephen Embleton.[16] The logo is an image of the Nommo in Dogon cosmology, twins who on land can take the form of fish walking on their tails.[17]
